item.description:
This is a cross posting with our Westchester Novice Hikers meetup friends who have hikes in very lovely parks and preserves in southern NY (the WNH posting). There are already up to 42 WNH members going!

We'll be joining in from 9 AM to about Noon on the trail projects that the WNH Organizer, Paula, has helped organized. Afterwords we'll get to spend the rest of the day enjoying the park! I've put a fee of $2 payable at the event to help the WNH group with all the logistics for this event. The following is mostly from the WNH posting (edited to fit here):


PLEASE JOIN THE WESTCHESTER NOVICE HIKERS
FOR THEIR FIRST ANNUAL NATIONAL TRAILS DAY EVENT -

NATIONAL TRAILS DAY PROJECTS @ CROTON POINT PARK

For Westchester Novice Hikers first Trails Day Event (and Hartford Area Hiking's), Paula's arranged for us to work on several Trail Restoration Projects at Croton Point Park.


CONTEXT...

* American Hiking Society's National Trails Day® (NTD), is held the first Saturday of every June and with more than 1000 events hosted by trail and community groups, public agencies, and businesses from coast to coast, is America's largest celebration of trails and the outdoors.

http://www.americanhi...

* Croton Point Park is a 508-acre County Park situated on a peninsula on the east shore of the Hudson River. This park offers year-round events and activities and has facilities for camping, hiking and swimming. The park rich in natural and human history is also the site of historic wine cellars that are thought of be the oldest in New York State and the Croton Point Nature Center, which offers a year-round schedule of interpretive programs.

http://westchestergov...


PROJECT DETAILS...

There will be several projects to choose from which MAY include:
1. HELPING CREATE A TRAIL ALONG THE HUDSON RIVER
2. WIDEN AN EXISTING TRAIL
3. CLEAR A DOWNHILL TRAIL AND ADD/REPOSITION WOODEN STEPS

Paula is working with the Park superintendent and others to determine what projects best suit their needs. Project details to come.

NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY!

Tools and training will be provided by CROTON POINT PARK.

Optional tools to bring (put your name on them just in case):
* Loppers
* Hand Shears (Hand Pruners)
* Small Bow Saws
* Trowels and other digging tools are helpful too

Required items:
* MUST wear Boots
* MUST wear Work/Gardening Gloves (bring extra if you can)
* BUG SPRAY (headnet may be helpful)
* Sunscreen
* Plenty of water (2-3 LITERS)
* Lunch and snacks
* Hat or bandanna is recommended

Optional items if you will be staying afterwords (see below!):
* Extra clothes
* Bathing suit/towels
* Extra food/snacks/drinks

Guests are allowed. No dogs. Kids over 14 are welcome who WANT to be there and can work!


AFTER THE WORK IS DONE...

Everyone can stay and enjoy the park facilities including the BEACH!

We can swim if there is a lifeguard on duty - if not we can still enjoy the sand, the river and the beautiful Hook Mountain and Rockland Lake State Park Views!


GETTING THERE...

Please meet at 9:00 AM, Croton Point Park Visitors Center.

There is a small lot at the visitors center - park there or along the side BUT please don't got past the entrance booth.

* PARKING WILL BE FREE.
* WE WILL SPLIT INTO GROUPS AND DRIVE TO THE SITES TOGETHER.

Location:
Croton Point Park
1A Croton Point Ave.
Croton on Hudson, NY 10520
(914) 862-5290

Approximate location/directions for meetup location via MapQuest (follow signs to park Visitor's Center/parking):
http://www.mapquest.c...
(Lat=41.19313, Long=-73.881709)

=== Legal Stuff ===

In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
